text: The high roller specialty pizza was excellent!! This was my first time there and I am already looking forward to my next!

If I could give less stars I woud. Should have read yelp reviews first. Man this was by far the worse pizza I have ever tasted. The stoned people at the party even  turned it down. There was so much sauce they could have made 4 pizzas those tiny Pepperoni's didn't stand a chance . So sad because I would have been a returning customer but all jokes aside there were so many red flags not to order from here from the phone call to order pizza being placed on hold for 20 mins but couldn't hang up because of a  conversation I could hear because I really wasn't placed onhold. Then the fact it took 1 hour to get  the pizza.  So sad that there is two whole pizzas left. Wasted Money......
Always delicious! I have gluten allergies and they have always been cautious of cross contamination . Difficult at a pizzeria but this is one I trust :)

The pizza is very good, this place really did a good job on its receipts because I never have tasted any pizza like this on the west coast. I order as large pizza for delivery and I got it fresh and got in no time their pizza cost a little more but it's worth it in my opinion, be the judge for yourself

My girlfriend & I ordered delivery, we also used the $30 for $40 Yelp deal. We ordered a Large Texas BBQ chicken  / Buffalo Chicken & Turkey Sandwich our food came in 45 mins , Hot & Yummy. I loved the Texas BBQ chicken it's now my new addiction :) next time I will visit the restaurant & use my 25% off Yelp Coupon.
My first time to vegas, some of the best pizza I have had in a long time! They were very nice, the blonde long haired manager is so sweet. Definitely coming back everytime.

This is probably the worst pizza I've ever had. I would never go here again. The wings were total garbage and tasted like rubber. The pizza crust was worse than a Boboli crust you buy at the grocery store. All around awful. The Mug Root Beer was good though.

This place is under new managment/ownership. Two years ago when they first opened, we could not wait to be back in town to order from them and did many times. It's now, no longer made with "fresh" homemade sauces.  Its... just cheep thin crust pizza. Unlike their name of "High Roller",  It was and is the worst pizza. You can get better pizza at a small time, home fair.

The staff is hilarious and makes you feel welcomed. We've been wanting to try this place for a while. The breadsticks are amazing! The pizza is really good as well, just wish they put a bigger portion of toppings on them. Definitely will be going back for more!

I love High Roller Pizza. The owner and staff give excellent service and most importantly fresh, delicious, hot pizza. If you are tired of every day boring , run of the mill pizza, then go to High Roller Pizza. For their Grand Re-opening the are having a buy one get one free of equal or lesser value If you pick up.... a great deal for families,  or those not in the mood to cook and looking to have a party or entertain friends. Just had the Greek flush.....o.m.g...to die for!!!! They are open late...12:00pm.-2:00 a.m.Sunday -Thursday, and open 24 hours Friday - Saturday.

My buddy picked up a pizza and its way overpriced. Frozen pizza is much better. i dont think they actually use fresh organic vegetables me and my buddy agree its the worse pizza weve ever had. Wouldnt recommend to anyone.

I have to say every time I come into this shop I get the best service and CUSTOMER service. Anthony and Bri are always so nice and accommodating. The food tastes great and I enjoy watching them make it in front of me.
Under new ownership. This is the worst pizza I've ever had. Disgusting. I'm eating ramen noodles for dinner now. $40 for one pizza and 12 wings. Do not eat here. It is not as good as it was.

By far one of the best pizza places in town, fresh ingredients, and great customer service. The people working there were really friendly,  and the pizza is instantly one of my new favorites. I wish I could give them more than 5 stars! Definitely recommend this place to anyone who appreciates great pizza.

If it were possible I would give this place no stars at all. Ok so first of all I chose to order from this place after seeing their very convincing advertisements. When we ordered the pizza we chose to have it delivered, not only was it the wrong pizza I don't know if it's spaghetti sauce they put on it or what but I couldn't even finish one. I have a free pizza now because of the mistake and I am too afraid to use it.
No good.. With all the great reviews here on Yelp I expected more.. Overpriced subpar pizza. Pictures of pizzas look better than they taste.
Stopped in with my family and it was overall good, but a bit pricey for what we got. Pizza is ok, may come back.
Great quality pizza!! My son is a pizza lover and was happy we tried this place!! The sandwiches are delicious too and the staff super friendly! Will definitely come back next time we are in Vegas!

Good luck, whomever bought this, drove an apparent good pizza place into the ground. My guess is that high roller story of winnings making the pizza, probably turned out to be a story of a loss of those winnings and had to sell. Don't waste your time or money. What a shame.

My bf and I ate here for the first time today, and being that my bf is from New York, he was skeptical to try a pizza labeled as "Vegas Style," but the advertisement of organic ingredients and a healthier meal lured us in. To our surprise, we were not disappointed at all. The food was really good and the staff was very friendly. We'll definitely be back again.

Horrible, horrible, horrible. Ordered a pizza from these clowns, after 2 hours it finally showed up. Cold as could be and they wouldn't do anything to rectify the situation. Finally, they offered a free pizza upon next order but wouldn't honor it next time we called...will NEVER order from this joke of a pizza shop again!

I used to love this place when it was original owner and the only pizza that my husband and I love was their High roller pizza. I tried it once when the ownership changed a little while ago and was so disappointed and didn't return back after that. But I'm so happy to find out that the original owner are now back and taking over the business again. I order my usual pizzas today and they are just perfect like before. Give this place another chance if you are just like me, disappointed in previous management or if you are looking for a good pizza place. Customer services are always great here, the owner and staffs are very pleasant and friendly.

Go to high roller every other day. Double down pizza is simply the best pizza in Las Vegas . Such a home made taste with so many toppings. I recommend this place. It's awesome and the workers are cool!

There is no way the positive reviews below can be real!  I gulped when a sandwich and a large pizza came out to over $50 with delivery, tip and tax, but I thought it might be something special.  I really wanted to like this pizza, thinking healthy/organic ingredients would make for a delicious pizza.  NOT SO!  The cheese and sauce are very bland.  I've had better pizza at some of the bigger chain stores and that's not a good thing.  The crust was soggy and floppy.  The pizza is cut like a checker board, making for awkward/messy eating.  The Italian sandwich was just okay, but nothing I would recommend.  The delivery girl was friendly, but was 30 minutes late according to the restaurant's own delivery estimate.  With so much competition, there's no real reason to order from here, sorry.  I feel ripped off for paying this much for so little.

I love my High Roller pizza yesterday. I have friends staying  at a time share on the strip. So got the large high roller and it was excellent    I also got two salads  great.  I ordered for a 4;30 pick and I got there at 4:15 and my pizza was in the oven. Ready on time. Employees were nice and friendly.  Very clean and smelt so good  I can't wait to try the Greece pizza  you won't be disappointed. I live in green valley please open one here

Very low quality pizza and ingredients.  The crust is too thin, and it makes the pizza turn cold minutes after opening it.  Just overall low quality, cheap food.  Really good prices tho.  I would not recommend.

Pizza was average tasting but it was very soggy to the point that if you tried to pick up a piece it would fall apart. Wings were not good at all and they were undercooked. I would not go back to this place.

My family ordered this pizza while we were staying on vacation in Las Vegas.  The delivery service to our hotel was great--very easy and prompt.  Overall, it is extremely delicious and high-quality, being made with organic and natural ingredients.  I was happy with the normal veggie pizza, and my kids loved the ham pizza they got.  However, we also ordered a buffalo chicken pizza for my husband.  I have to say, it was the most ridiculously hot sauce we have ever eaten.  I tried some, and it was tear-inducing, even with only two bites.  My husband loves spicy food, and puts Tabasco on everything.  While he way able to finish the pizza (I never could have), it became more of a "Man vs. Food" challenge, and wasn't enjoyable at all.  And the pain lasted two days :)  Please exercise caution if ordering the buffalo wings or buffalo pizza, as the sauce goes way beyond pleasantly hot to painfully hot.

Second time having pizza here and it was Sooooo good! All ingredients are fresh, crust is cooked perfectly & love that the pizza isn't super greasy, also the staff & owner are very friendly which is the cherry on top! This is definitely our new pizza spot!

Best Pizza ! Good Price !! Friendly Service !!! ^_^
Fast Delivery !!!! *  Awesome * Very fresh pizza.

Sunday July 12th we ordered a large pepperoni, artichoke , mushroom pizza 1/2 basil 1/2 jalapeño; however, when the pizza was delivered at Worldmark by Wyndham S Las Vegas Blvd we received a large pepperoni. We immediately contacted the restaurant back and was told by Hunter that he was going to contact the driver. We waited 20 minutes and called back to find that our pizza was being remade because of the error. That was at 10:30. We knew that you closed at 11:00, but, thought that in good faith we could get our pizza.  When it wasn't delivered by 11:00 we called back and of course the shop was closed. We paid $45 cash for a large 4 topping pizza and received a 1 topping pizza. We waited to get a pizza, never received it and had to eat a cold pizza. 

This is an unfortunate event and it's even more unfortunate that you have employees working for the company that aren't true to their word and don't care about customer service. 

I'm giving a 1 star rating due to the customer service.  I Can't comment on the pizza due to it being cold and not what we ordered.

Great pizza great service! The driver forgot my soda and instead of just telling me sorry he went to the local store and bought me a soda and brought it back. So sweet plus the manager (I'm guessing) offered a free pizza if he didn't get the soda in time just all around amazing  service and amazing pizza!  I will deff b a long time customer!

Called and placed order for delivery, They said it would arrive in 45 minutes. An hour goes by so I call to check on it. They said it was just then going in the oven, that there was a computer glitch.... To try and compensate me for the delay they discounted my order and said they would send me extra food. When the pizza arrived (almost two hours from the time I placed order) they had forgotten the ranch, didn't bring me the extra food that was promised and the pizza was cold, and not cut. Horrible customer service! Won't ever order from these guys again.

We got the Greek roulette pizza. The crust was thin which I like. But it was hard and dry. I prefer a crisp chewy crust.  
The pesto sauce was almost non existent. 
The cheese... Where was the cheese? There was feta but where was the mozzarella??? Very scant cheese.  
Real kalamata olives. Few artichoke hearts. Overall very heavy on the toppings but almost no cheese. 
I've heard the cheese pizza is very good but after this experience I'll probably order from somewhere else. 

We did have to wait a long time to place out order. The hold time online was longer than id like.  We actually got disconnected and had to call back. 

The highlight was the delivery driver. Very nice and polite. He even took out trash that was sitting at the door.

I have to say, the guys who work here are FANFRICKINTASTICAL. The pizza just isn't my style. Part of me wishes it were because the guys who work there went way above and beyond. 

I ordered pizza on a Friday night. I asked them if they had Dr. Pepper and the guy said, "Oh man, we don't and it's my ALL TIME FAV!"

When the delivery dude showed up at my door he had a special Dr. Pepper for me. Folks, they went to the store and got me Dr. Pepper. I gave him a $10 tip and said holy cow, best service ever. I felt like royalty. 

I might give them another shot solely based on the amazing customer service.

This place is no longer organic and is under new ownership/management.  The staff used to be so welcoming and the new people are rude.  They won't accept the restaurant.com certificates purchased under the old ownership...I was told to call restaurant.com for a refund.  The cleanliness has also gone downhill- kitchen was filthy!!!

Went in and grabbed the "snake eyes" pizza today. Best pepperoni I've ever had. Super cool place. I'll be back to see Anthony and Sherri again, great costumer service. Another thing that stands out from most pizza places is all of the organic toppings and ingredients. And you can taste and feel the difference. If you're looking for some quality pizza head over to High Roller !

This pizza is totally mediocre at best. Absolutely nothing special. So 2 stars. The fact that it was $38 for 2 medium AFTER a 25% "like us on Facebook" discount means it would have been $50 for 2 medium pizzas.!!! Seriously? 1 was cheese 1 was meat lovers. Both were medium. $50?!?! Plus tip for delivery. -1 star for price. Also they said 30-40 min for delivery, took almost 1.5 hour. Look elsewhere....

I've been eating this pizza for about 6 months now because of the word organic plastered all over their cars and the exorbitant pricing for their food just until recently when I saw a parmesan cheese pack that was regular toxic cheese I thought I had pretty much asked before when talking to one of the chefs about how it's the only organic pizza place in vegas etc but apparently these guys are okay with letting their customers believe that they are eating an organic toxin free meal when really it's not so anyways I wasn't going to order again but for some reason I did empty mindedly when craving pizza and when I went to get it I remembered the cheese so I ask the guy if the mozerella of organic and he says "uhhh no" and I'm like really I've been eating this all this time? And this was after I had to cancel a pizza because they didn't want to give me the Saturday deal($4 off of a $19 medium pizza) lost a sale and a customer for life...I'm 100% organic and this seriously messed up my diet and now I don't even trust anywhere!! I won't be eating here again that's for sure!

Favorite and BEST pizza in Las Vegas. This is thee ONLY  place you can buy pizza and not get this gut bomb in your belly afterwards.  This restaurant truly is going above and beyond with their ingridents and is something you can not only taste, but feel.  The pizza is great.  I had an opportunity to meet the owners and they were very aware of what was going on in the shop and always trying to make it better, excellent operators here.  Thanks Sherri!! Customer for life, Highly recommend.

Wow! What a pizza! We ordered the High Roller Pizza and a dozen of the pesto parm wings, with no regrets! On top of being all natural/organic ingredients and responsibly raised meats, golly it was delicious! Talk about a symphony of savory flavors! At least double the price of your run-of-the-mill pizza joint, but also double the quality; absolutely worth it for that once in a while, treat-yourself pizza night. We'll be back!
Yummy & tasty pizzas! Good prices and quality ingredients! Definitely would come her again :)

I thought the ingredients were supposed to be top quality, and maybe they are, but they had no flavor. I had a tasteless gluten free veggie. The prices are almost doubled that of Pizza Hut, only thing is that Pizza Hut has more flavor.

Love this place! Had the late night munchies so I looked up pizza on Yelp and found this place. Brian was super friendly and offered to delivered the pizza himself, he showed up in a SWEET A$$ HUMMER and let me hop inside to check it out. This was hands down the best service I've experienced compared to any food delivery chain ever!  If your hungry holla at my boy Brian and he'll get you taken care of!

I heard about this place & wanted to try. I went to dine and the place was very dull. Thought it was more of a pizza parlor but it seemed more like a Carry-out place. Ordered the High Roller Pizza. It was very good and had a lot of delicious toppings..! I would def recommend trying this place if you like thin crust pizza!
First time here and love it. Got the pepperoni pizza and was awesome, the sauce was very flavorful and the thin crust cooked perfect, I will be back .

As soon as we walked in and informed we were there to pick up a pizza, it felt like we were not welcome. Like it was a burden that we came and asked for our order. We ordered online and we got a confirmation that said it would be ready for pick up at 7:01 but in reality when we got into the store at 7:05, the pizzas were not yet in the oven. We left at 7:25. Those were minor things compared to the apparent manager, maybe owner, berating his employee about putting sauce too close to the crust. Not a smart thing to do in front of your customers and probably not the way you want to treat your employees. Pizza was a 7/10. Won't be coming back. Hopefully this place changes the way it treats its customers and employees.

This is my first time being at High Roller Pizza. The staff was very friendly and sociable. We couldn't decide on what pizza to have because they all sounded great. So Chef Anthony asked us what we don't like. So we told him what we didn't like and yet as a couple we can never agree on anything. So he decided to make us our own side of the pizza.

Once we got the pizza it smelt AMAZING!!! We took the first bite it was a little bit hot in temperature so we let it cool down for couple minutes. Once it cool down we tried it again and it was delicious. You could taste every flavor from the barbecue sauce to the cheeses into the chicken. You can taste the freshness of each item. However after having a couple slices my mouth started to burn a little and that was from their barbecue sauce. I told Chef Anthony and he told me that they are working on fixing that spice level. That made me happy. 

Overall this is one of the greater pizza places in Las Vegas. Yes it may be on the more expensive side however you pay for what you get!!!

Today they opened with new menu and new management. Highly recommend stopping by and trying out the pizza and wings. Ignore all the bad reviews over the last few months and give this place a try. 
3 choices of sauce and lots of toppings. It was nice to be able to watch the pizza get made and decide what we wanted on the pizza as it is being made.
Our first pizza we ordered was a 16" Hawaiian pizza with the original sauce. The family loved the pizza and it was great to see the kids eat the crust (most pizza places they throw away the crust).
The second pizza was a 16" with organic sauce and pepperoni, italian sausage and spicy capicola. The sauce was GREAT! The entire pizza was great.
I am looking forward to my next trip to try another combination of sauce and toppings.

Ordered a large pizza for delivery and I specifically asked for easy sauce and chicken and mushrooms on one side only where I was staying at the Cancun resort they only brought the pizza to the lobby and then had the lobby call and request to have me or my husband come down to pick up the pizza instead of them delivering it to the room when we receive the pizza the pizza was not as we ordered it was very dry heavy sauce and mushroom and chicken all over the pizza we called the guy explained to us that he would replace the pizza with the pizza that we had ordered in the first place half cheese and half chicken and mushroom so we received a call to my cell phone from the delivery guy who stated that he was about toDrive into the parking lot and for us to meet him in the parking lot to pick up the pizza that was replaced that weird just ordered yet again, needless to say I will never order from here again.
Great place, great food, great service!!! No need to right a lengthy review and nit pick and disect a meal.

Imagine a New York thin crust pizza that stays intact! Their thin crusts are baked crisp, so the ingredients stay together with each bite. 
The texas holdem pizza was rich in barbeque sauce and drowning in chicken and bacon; truly for a meat lover. The double down pizza had a mild pesto sauce that does not overwhelm the mushroom, tomato and meat in the pizza.
The cooking time took a little longer than an average New York thin crust pizza due to the rich toppings.
The workers were friendly and accomodating.
For a foodie from OC, this organic pizza sure did hit the spot.

The pizza was nice and crunchy, but I still feel like they could amp the sauce. I asked for extra, and I still don't believe I got extra. Pizza was on the verge of dry but not as bad as others have said. However, the flavor of the ingredients in my pizza choice made up for the lack of sauce. The staff is cool... And the place is close. Next time I go I will make sure to say extra extra sauce lol.

I called in my order to ensure it would be correct, so you can imagine how disappointed I was that it was not. 1/2 Philly 1/2 pepperoni, sausage, green peppers, opinions & olives with EXTRA regular sauce. We were hard pressed to see any sauce. I called & spoke to the same gentleman that took my order. He said he made it & guaranteed it had sauce & told me to look in the middle for it. Said he didn't hear me say extra sauce, although he had repeated it to me during the process. No offer to make good next time. Just an explanation that I was wrong. For $30 I would expect more toppings or at least recommend it to me. I would have paid.

Amazing first time experience..customer service, quality AND taste!! We called in to order but wasn't ready when we arrived. We hung out inside and just talked stories with the workers! Felt so personal able and comfortable! Then we got our food, took it home and fell in love! We got the buffalo wings and the straight veggie pizza. OMGG reading the description of the straight veggie got me to order, but eating it now got me hooked!! I LOVEDDD how thin the crust was, that all the veggies on it felt fresh and duhh how it tasted!! 

Then the buffalo wings were just..perfect!! The sauce was to die for..hot but not too hot but tasted hot!! Haha it was a must order next time!! 

Left overs here we come!!

Stayed in Vegas with some friends for Bachelor Party and had a quite a few hungry friends. They whipped 3 specialty Pizzas in no time. Good service, tasty thin crust pizzas were consumed very quickly. Would go back if Im ever in Vegas again.

The pizza was good. It's nice to see a place like this open in Southern  Highlands. The staff is very friendly and helpful. It was clean and plenty of seating. The are a little  pricey and they need to keep the lunch buffet a little  better stocked

Who ever the new owners that took over this pizza place ruined a good pizza spot. 
I ordered a Hawaii pizza and there was barely any cheese, pineapple and ham. WAY too much sauce.  
I called back and their response was "we make our pizzas with portion control... The toppings and sauce are pre measured." Well whoever's the mastermind behind this needs a new occupation.

I ordered here on ubereats. Pizza was really nasty and undercooked. I got onion and green peppers for toppings and it was basically like raw when I bit into it! I didn't even finish eating it. The fries were just store bought frozen fries baked in the oven. Very blah. I would never order from here again and I'm not even a picky eater.

The best pizza I've ever eaten! The Four of a Kind (cheese) is delicious. Their new white pizza, the Lady Luck, is my new favorite. I've not had anything at High Roller that I didn't love. I now eat far too much pizza.
2nd time ordering from. Not impressed limited flavor dry pizza. Tonight ordered a Gryo. Don't ever do that. Little meat sauce horrible and stale pita bread.
Meeeega dope pizza. Perfect crust, super tasty pizza, we got down on six pizzas at Artifice the other night.

I ordered through grub hub on a Tuesday night and it took an hour and 15 minutes! Pretty good, got a create your own with garlic and basil, but it got soggy by the time it was here. having to microwave pizza when it gets to your house is not cool!!

I would give this place a negative star if I could.  Worst customer service... Was trying to get 25% discount and lady at the register said it was too late. Also other deals for special days on the menu but again no service to offer the upgrades. 

Too make matters worst no wings available. No sorry we are out. Manager isn't customer friendly either.  Not worth the price of the pizza.

Says "pizza by slice", walked in to ask if they have a pizza by slice ready and guy with beard gives me the "what kinda question is that" nod with his head like I asked him to donate a kidney or something. I'm new to the area and if this is how you plan on welcoming new customers you might wanna rethink that.

7-28-15 update: 
You should see owner's reply! She says "we have right to refuse service to anyone, stop attacking this business". Way to handle customers! I saved a screenshot I'll post it. And then she blocked me

Under new management not the same place 

Food took a while to get here, had to repeat my self a lot with the guy over the phone he wasn't listening 

Pizza isn't the way it was described on coupon online.  

Menu on yelp is old owners they don't have the same items.

Went in here for lunch yesterday to try it out since I am interested in eating at/supporting organic and non-gmo restaurants.  Pizza was outstanding and fresh and fairly priced as well for quality ingredients like they are using.  Two gentleman who were working there were also really good guys that were willing to talk about the quality of ingredients being used and gave the place an overall good vibe.  Hope the owner expands over to green valley pkwy area as I think they would do well on this side of town by the track record of another organic spot near there.  In future locations, my only recommendation would be to make it a bit more inviting to eat in as there were only a few small tables along the wall in this location.  I will be bringing some more customers your way for sure!  Keep up the good work!

Love this place. After the fiasco at 800 degrees pizza (flour everywhere but sells gluten free pizza?), High Roller pizza was a dream. I had a GF pepperoni and Mushroom and my husband had a Hawaiian pizza. Yum!!! The toppings were generous, the sauce is homemade and everything was delicious. I highly recommend this restaurant.

So overpriced.   30 to 40 dollars a pizza and it was terrible    Awful crust, we ordered pepperoni.  Ghastly.    Makes Pizza Hut look like gourmet pizza.     Don't waste your money here.   Way better pizza in this town

Some of the best pizza I've ever had in my life! My favorite is the Greek Roulette. I also love the Double Down. Pesto-alfredo sauce, chicken, asiago & mozzarella cheese...amazing.
They have many different specialty pizzas, subs, even wings.Lots of choices :-) There's definitely something for everybody here!!
The pizza was amazing, the crust is so good. I order the high roller pizza and they definitely aren't skimpy on the toppings. Very delicious!

When the pizza arrived the driver pulled it out the heat bag turning them on it sides so the pizzas slid to one side and when we mentioned that to him he just gave me a blank stare and didnt even say sorry. The hot wings were the oldest and the hardest thing that i have tasted in a very long time. This is the second time ive ordered from them and will MAYBE give them one more shot but i will NEVER RECOMMENED them to anyone.  #thumbsdown
Pizza is not good I'm sad to say:(.  But nice staff! Owner on site very positive and pleasant.

I really want to love this spot. But, unfortunately, they just keep missing the mark. They recently lowered their prices, finally, so I ordered a ton of food on mypizza.com... I then get a call that it's 2 and a 1/2 hours for delivery?! Cancel! I've enjoyed their pizza in the past, but as a business, they need to really up their game. You'll make a lot more business with those new prices, but you gotta be prepared to keep up with the demand. 3 stars for the food... When I actually get it. I went with another local joint tonight.

Thank you for the great pizza and customer service we had a great pizza party with our family visiting and toped it off with a great wine to go with your gluten free pizza once again u guys out did urself thanks again from ur favorite customer at one Las Vegas Steven and Paula  thanks u guys rock!!!!
We had it once, and that's plenty. Super thin crust, I saw no sign of sauce. 10$ delivery charge, It was a let down. Unless your into the freezer section cracker crust thing to each his own

I walked in, with the plan to order pizza. The cook was preparing a sandwich, so I ordered the Meatball sandwich for myself. I was ordering on the spot, so I asked for light sauce, extra cheese and buns toasted open. When I arrived home, my sandwich was not soggy and toasted to perfection. The young men that were working, we're both very nice and we able to answer all of my questions. I  give sandwich a  and will be returning to try some of the pizzas too!
Super friendly staff. Gave great recommendation. We got the double down pizza and it was so good. If you're passing by definitely stop by and check it out!

This place could easily be 5 star. Guy behind the counter was great! I mean great!! They were out of parmesan packs, so he proceeds to pull out a bag of fresh shredded parmesan and chop it and put into 2 containers. No charge. Pizza was good, not great. Would like it a little more crisp with some more cheese, but it was good. House salad was amazing. Super Fresh, outstanding croutons and very good portion for the price. My biggest complaint, the Ranch Dressing, it sucked. Need to give this another go guys, people are increasingly using Ranch on not only a salad (my purpose) but pizza and fries as well. Had to stop at another restaurant on the way home to pick up some quality Ranch to eat with my salad.

To Sherri Ds "compliment" she sent me asking me did i even try the pizza. Um ... Did u read the review? Clearly I didn't and thats because your phone guy upselled me on a medium one topping. For miss sherri d to be an entrepreneur i guess she thinks its justified that her menu states one price but the price i was given over the phone was almost 10$ more then what the menu states. The customer is always right ma'am. Maybe you havent been on your entrepreneur venture long enough to know that yet but i wouldnt give a dam if the pig or cow you get your meat from was made out of gold... If your menu says one price and i call and hear something totally different im gna be put off by that. And your phone guy just thought i was going to go along with it and pay it? Instead of complaining to me about leaving a bad review you should be more focused on what u did to get it in the first place. Im a dancer in vegas and make a very comfortable living so it wasnt about the money it was the dishonesty in it. If i had looked at the menu and seen that price and it was consistent with what he said on the phone i would have ordered. So convincing me ur pizza is worth the 30$ is not addressing the conflict at hand. Ur ignoring my issue to try n cover it up by saying everythings organic. BYE LADY

I'm impressed by the concept these guys r bringing to the table! The pizza crust it nice and crispy. The pizza sauce is different in a good way, the texture reminded me of a marinara, I dug it, plus you can tell it was very fresh! Good for these guys, always nice to find a place making good food they believe in, keep up the good work! we will be back.

We have ordered several times but are disappointed with a pizza that looks like it was thrown against the wall and then boxed up. The person on the phone taking our order seemed delayed and had to repeat her questions. I called to report this and who ever I was directed to didn't seem apologetic. Needless to say, we won't be ordering from this pizza establishment any longer.
Pretty good pizza but a little too high of price . Will go back but don't like the higher prices although the ingredients are higher quality .

Well I tried this place since it was close to the hotel I was staying at. 
It wasn't the most horrible pizza and chicken fingers I have ever had but pretty close to it. 
The fingers were thin and rubbery probably because they were cooked in a microwave and then covered with sauce. 
The pizza which was sliced in the box it was delivered in and that allowed the bottom of the box to fall apart tasted like the box. A cardboard flavored crust and the ingredients were minimal at best. I asked for extra onion and I think that it was one ring chopped into 6 pieces and placed as to where it would be cut. 
Not sure how the main page shows that they have 3 1/2 stars but I will not be recommending nor returning. 
For the cost I would have been better to go to a grocery store and nuked my own.

Tonight was my first time ordering from High Roller Pizza. Very impressed with the staff and the service. The pizza was heavenly! They use organic,free-range, non GMO ingredients. The crust is thin and crispy and the ingredients are all fresh. They also use real cheese. They just gained themselves a new customer! Welcome to the neighborhood High Roller Pizza!  Best pizza I've had so far on the Strip

When high roller pizza first opened up I was like hmmmmm and I gave them a shot as all the ingredients were fresh and it was just a great pizza all the way around but this pizza I had today was just horrible. According to the lady to who my order she said there is a change of management and they changed the pizza sauce and everything else but if you want my opinion that was a bad business move as this pizza is now at the bottom of my list.Too much competition out there and other places have better pizza like Grimaldis,Metro,Rosatis Pizza, and other places that have much better pizza.

This was by far some of the best pizza I've had in a very long time.  My pepperoni pizza was handmade and took a good 15-20 minutes to receive, but the wait was worth it!  All ingredients were made extremely fresh and I left craving more.  I used to think Domino's had good quality, but this was definitely a step above.  I only had one small gripe, there was no Pepsi available (only diet), but I figured I need to drink healthy anyway and got a water.  The manager Anthony is very polite and takes pride in his ingredients and staff.  Would come back again!
Best veggie pizza. Good fast easy service. Ate a whole pizza to myself. My 8 year old loves it too.

I FINALLY got to try this pizza.. I fly back and forth to Vegas every once in a while and I have multiple friends who eat this pizza.. Even though finding food in Vegas is not difficult- finding quality ingredients like the ones they use is not as commonplace in LV as it is in Oregon. I loved their gluten free crust. Will definitely be a repeat customer!

by itself, i give 4 stars, but compared to other options nearby, in regards to portion and pricing, id drop it down to 3 stars.

ordered a large pizza that was half greek roulette / half wild card.  the greek half was full of flavors that blended well together, and the wild card half was definitely above and beyond your average pepperoni pie in terms of taste.  I'm not usually a fan of thin crust, or pizza cut into squares for that matter, but this was baked just right and overall a good pizza.

again, my issue is with portion and price.  i have no problem dropping $30 on a pie from Joes, but i walk out with a 19 inch pizza that won't even fit in my fridge.  the 16 inch large pizza from HighRoller was a bit underwhelming (for the price).  that 3 inches may not seem like much, but its actually a huge difference.

*Using the surface area equation: A=Pi x R2
16 inch pizza   3.14x 8 x 8 =200.96 
19 inch pizza   3.14 x 9.5 x 9.5 =283.38 

i also ordered a philly sub.  hands down delicious.  grass fed beef has a gamey flavor that was complimented by the mushrooms and peppers.  also mozzarella was a surprisingly good choice to round it out (although there could have been more of it).  again, delicious.  but we come back to portion and pricing.  if a Capriottis sub had a premature baby... the subs here would be it.

i purchased the yelp deal that was worth $40, and in return i got a 16 inch pizza, a sub, and a 20oz soda.  not sure the value is there.  i realize the cost of organic/free range/non processed ingredients drive up the price, but it seems a bit too much (or maybe I'm just cheap).

company should consider providing a bit more info on the ingredients that demand these prices.  people who seek out healthy food alternatives want more than just an organic or free range stamp (like what state the veggies are grown in, or what farm the animals are from).  "High Roller Pizza carefully handpicks and scrutinizes every single one of their ingredients" yet offers very little detailed information to the customer.

all that being said, ill certainly be back.  its right down the street from me, and a great alternative to the chain pizza joints.

Now this is some good pizza!!! The fact that its organic and free range products is just a plus. The staff was super friendly and even made us a custom heart-shaped pizza pie for Valentine's. The price was a bit up there but you absolutely get what you pay for... And that's quality! Happy Valentine's day and thanx again High Roller Pizza for completing our special request, you're the best!

Phenomenal pizza! Very happy with the menu options, prices, service, and ingredients. Everything is always very tasty, they don't rip your head off with high prices, you can taste the quality in the ingredients and are always very friendly and courteous. Highly recommended.

Not good :(

This pizza was very bland and the crust was way too thin. Sad to say I would not recommend this spot.
The service was good both workers were very nice however the pizza just was not good.

Absolutely delicious pizza and amazing service!!! This place is right down my house off the Boulevard. Got chicken wings and a large pepperoni pizza with jalapenos and roasted garlic the pizza was cooked perfectly the crust was nice and crispy everything was fresh and the man that delivered the Pizza was so sweet family owned place will be back!!!
This was my first time going to the high roller. I had an amazing experience! Very friendly staff with amazing pizza at a very affordable price.

Should probably update your Yelp page.  Just moved to the area and was super excited to try your pizza... I see your smart cars at the Smiths lot and think they're fun. Thing is, Yelp says your open until 2am. Other websites say 11pm (it's a Sunday at 9pm). Checked in to get 25% off and now my offer is going to expire before I can use it. Also, your go to voicemail cuts off at the beginning and doesn't sound as good as it can be. Wanted to get jazzed about my new pizza spot... Guess I'll see what else is open.

First time coming here and it is amazing! The staff is so nice and upbeat!! I got the hi roller it has everything mozzarella. Pepperoni. Sausage. Bacon. Ham. Tomatoes. Green peppers. Onions. Banana peppers. Mushrooms. And black olives. I mean damn. Haha! Good stuff must try!! Plus when you check in you get 20 % off your order. Bonus!! Come get some pizza!! Boom!!

Estaba de vacaciones en Las Vegas Nevada , yo vivo en San Francisco ca , cansada de caminar buscamos una pizza ya que teníamos ambre , nos contesto un Sr. nos tomo nuestra información y dijo que nos llamaría , y jamás  nos llamo y la pizza nunca llego , por lo menos hubiera dicho que no la mandaría, para pedirla a otra pizzería,  jamás volveré a ocupar los servicios de ellos

This used to be a GREAT pizza place, all natural and organic....NO LONGER ORGANIC OR NATURAL.

They are under new management/ownership and it is a disaster.  I called in an order last night, the guy asked for my address at least 3 times and then started talking to someone else instead of listening to me, so I had to keep starting over.  

After about 45 minutes I get a call from a guy asking me if I ordered pizza.  I said yes I ordered two.  He asked me for my address because the original guy who asked me for my address several times got the street wrong.

I told this guy and he said he would be right here.  When he arrived he asked me how I heard about this place and I told him we have ordered from here several times.  His response was wow, I never delivered here before???

The pizza's did not look like the picture on the front page here, the ingredients were all over the box.  Now I find out they are NO LONGER using Natural & Organic ingredients?  Last time we will EVER order from this place.  I cannot say they are even like all the rest now, they are worse.  Sad to see the original owner gone, she ran a classy place, cared about the customers and tried to make sure everyone had an enjoyable experience.

I'm not usually one to write reviews but this was necessary. We had decided to order High Roller for delivery from the good reviews. Upon receiving our order, noticed that the driver was careless and half of the ingredients were on one side of the pizza. 

To top it off, the entire large pie was UNCUT. How do you even manage to forget that?!? If you're concerned about a timely delivery, at least pay attention to your quality and how you pack the pizza into the car as well.
Good pizza, it's the closest I have gotten to NYC pizza and I like the customer service.  They are very friendly.

My family and I are passing through Vegas and found this place. We were hoping to sit down and relax but it's more of a take out type of place. We were about to leave and the owner ran out and gave us a menu. I felt since she made that effort we would take it back to our room.  Super nice family owned place! The pizza was super fresh and the salads were amazing.  The owner was appreciative for our business and gave our boys a bottle of Sprite. Please support this business!

This afternoon we ordered a half sausage and half pepperoni pizza. The delivery actually arrived quickly (just under a half hour), paid the driver cash, bring it in, open it up and it was a plain cheese pizza... they brought a replacement pizza over nearly two hours later...

I would say 0 but that's not an option. I ordered pizza at 1130am on a Sunday and at 1pm I called to ask where the pizza was and the guy who answered the phone said it was on the way! Another half hour later I received the pizza! The delivery guy said"sorry we had problems With the dough." What the hell! What kind of excuse is that? After that I had 3 cold pizzas for myself because my study group had already left! NEVER AGAIN!

The 45 minute drive was well worth it. The food was f-ing amazing, the guys are f-ing hilarious, new management is definitely a plus for this place. Jesus christ so good. 100 % new favorite spot. All the dopeness.

Originally from the bay area but I've moved a LOT.  So have tried pizza everywhere.  I love my Las Vegas haunts and High Roller Pizza is one of them.  Every time I go it's a jackpot - excuse the pun.  Really fresh, organic, you feel satisfied, not full.  The smell  is irresistable.  Great job, guys!  And I love that you deliver in Smart Cars :)  Turned all my Vegas friends on to you and will continue to.

I'd say take out or delivery would be preferred. Not really an environment you'd want to hang out and eat your pizza. Just a few tall tables, no music, no fountain drinks (there are two coolers with bottled drinks to purchase). After ordering our pizza and paying for it, we noticed the Monday special on the menu board to receive a free pizza with any 16" pizza purchase. We asked about it and the guy seemed annoyed that we even asked. We proceeded to ask if we can still have the special and he just shook his head and mumbled yeah. My husband tried conversations with him in a friendly manner and the guy gave short responses and never looked up at him. Less than good customer service. Not very friendly people working this day. Also, the floor in the public area is very dirty. Pepperoni pizza was a bit greasy (like the pepperoni's were filled with grease) but it tasted great. No trash can to throw away our stuff. Definitely a place to pick up or delivery. Very awkward environment. As we left no one said thank you or goodbye until we said it as we were walking out the door. IF we ever feel like eating here again it will not be dine in.

I just ordered from here for the first time tonight and I had the BEST experience!!! I spoke with Jarvis on the phone and he helped me with my order, they were out of the cheese I wanted so he made some other suggestions and they were AWESOME! He ended up delivering it himself and he just had outstanding customer service and I was SOOOO PLEASED with how the pizza turned out!! I got the GLUTEN FREE crust loaded w veggies and I am in heaven right now!!! I def found my new delivery spot!!! Thank you!

This place is phenomenal. They have a wide variety of thin crust pizzas on the menu. I definitely will frequent this place to try the variations as well as the sandwiches on the menu. Sounds like they are coming out with wings on the menu soon and I already circled the date on my calendar to be back for that.
The Pizza simply was not good. Got the Greek Flush pizza. Crust was bad and the pizza was bland. They delivered quickly though!
Delicious pizza! Was ready at time promised and tasted GREAT! Appreciate the yummy and organic quality. Will be my "go to" pizza place in my neighborhood.
No longer all natural and organic!!!! High Roller was an amazing pizza joint that was pricey but worth every penny. Now its just your average pizza place :-(

Just moved to the area and tried to find a good local pizza place. This was not it. Ordered 2 medium of their specialty pizzas; got 2 smalls, but luckily was only charged for smalls. Okay, fine. But some of the toppings listed on the menu did not make it to the pizza, the crust was rubbery and flavorless, and I was generally unimpressed. Only made it to 2 stars because the hot wings weren't bad. $40+ for delivery with tip for 2 small pizzas and 10 wings; not at all worth the price.
Wow the change that was made by Jarvis at high roller pizza!!!! They bettered the pizza here by far. If you have the chance to eat here do it, I will definitely be back for more!!!!!
I love pizza but not theirs...which is too bad because it's very close to my house. The sauce was mediocre, at best, and somehow they managed to burn the crust. I won't be returning.

I ordered a pizza on the website.  Created a login with my Facebook.  The order never came and we checked 4 times that it was in there.  It cleared from my account about 10 minutes ago.  I tried calling 3 times but nobody answered.  The voicemail says that they are closed Christmas day....it's middle of January.

The pizza is good but not great.  The crust was a little burnt and the sauce was not real impressive.  The pepperoni was a little spicy and good.  Overall, we will probably not go out of our way to buy this pizza again.

I just went here with my boyfriend and customer service was horrible. The cashier was rude, didn't welcome us in just handed us a menu and asked "what do you want". We order a cheese pizza and some fries. The pizza was decent but the fries weren't even cooked they were super soggy and had no salt or seasoning. Not only were they not cooked but there was hair in them as well. The dining area itself is weird they only have two card tables in the very back and next to the tables the workers are just sitting there watching a movie. Very unprofessional. Maybe it's the new management now but this place definitely went downhill.

I ordered the high roller for delivery smelled so good in the box Its really good quality pizza a lot better then joes NY pizza taste really fresh I like this pizza place probably be ordering another pizza again soon

I will never spend my money here again!!!!

It took over an hour for my delivery and I love less then 3 minutes away... I ordered  a club sandwich, chicken wings, and cheese bread... not only was the hot food cold but I got an Italian sub...when I called to complain I was told to call back. So I did. I asked for a refund just for the sandwich and I would pick it up tomorrow  I was told I couldn't without bringing back the food... he offered to have the driver come pick up the sandwich but I could come pick up the money from the store when they open tomorrow... after all the ridiculousness I just hung up...
Pizza was very good and the staff was great! They even delivered me and my pizza to my Rv park!

So after seeing the commercials and the text for a free slice a pizza, my friend and I decided to try them out since we were over that way. We walked in and told him we were there to get the promotional "free" slice. The young man then turned to the refrigerator and took out a pan of pizza with 2 slices and we asked was that the pizza he was about to give us?? And he replied yes it was from earlier this morning!! UMMM needless to say we walked out and didnt even want the free slice of cold refrigerated pizza he was about to reheat. First impressions are lasting and based off this we wont be going back to try anything.

If I could rate less than one star I would!!! I placed an order online and I called three times to verify my order and the address after 2 hours they all of sudden does not have the order or address wth they are the worst!!!!!!!
Warm and friendly service.  Located on Las Vegas Boulevard but has a home town feel. Food was priced a buck or two higher than other pizza shops but the crust is addictive!  Over all good experience.

So I heard how good the food is here after the new management took over and all I can say is YES. I drove 40 mins across town during peak traffic hours to get this pizza and it was worth every minute I spent cursing at other drivers. THIS PLACE IS A MUST TRY. They make it right in front of you and the guys are funny as hell. They get all the stars.

Brought my girlfriend here and got a heart shaped pizza courtesy of letting them know that I was coming in for a date night. 

The staff was awesome and we got a chance to banter back and forth while we waited for our pizza. 

We got an incredible pizza with a crispy crust and sauce that's out of this world. If you get a chance, stop by here and grab some pizza!

Had the cheese pizza once. It was ok. Just ok.  But they wont do swap outs. For example; I don't eat beef and I asked for the Philly sub with either chicken or turkey. Guy on the phone said he couldn't do it. Alrighty then.

Let's get high.
Roller.
Pizza.
Wait, no. That was the old restaurant. Once again, High Roller Pizza has new management (as of 6/13/16)  and this time it seems they're dedicated to getting it right. The new official name is "High Roller Pizzeria" (see what they did there?), the menu consists of many of the original specialty pizzas customers have come to love, and the staff is very friendly.

But you're here for the verdict on the pizza.

Well, I'm no Judge Judy but the jalapeño/pineapple (my fave) that the chef whipped up was very satisfying. The ingredients were fresh and most importantly, the cheese was nice and gooey but not over the top. The pizza didn't have that nasty grease you get with $1 cheese slices in New York (that you have to dab with a napkin) but it did have a similarly thin crust. Not super thin; but not California-style crust. In between. It works. Had a slight buttery taste which I liked.

This is the kind of pizza that is deceptively delicious. It seems like a lightweight Amir Khan pizza but a few slices in and you are officially a heavyweight/fat ass.

There was a steady stream of customers coming in while I waited for my pizza. Surprising since this place was officially closed the past few weeks as the new management took over. Good location or branding, I guess? Or maybe people love the way the pizza tastes. I did oooooobviouslyyy. 

I also met the owners and they are hella cool. Yep. 

"...Hella."

As I'm new to the area figured I'd give this place a try... First thing when walking in there's really no comfy setting to dine in. There's a few high tables and chairs. Now that's ok if it's mainly a take out spot. My best friend and I a huge pizza and wing guys. So naturally we ordered a large pepperoni and order of wings. It was $40! For a 14inch pizza, 12 wings, and to smaller bottle drinks (no fountains) and very limited beverage selection. Now so far I'm still on the fence. While sitting waiting for the food we both noticed something called wing Wednesday. This was 6 free wings when spending over $30. Although this was not offered to us we mentioned it. The younger kid behind the counter actually said they don't offer it because it's not cost effective for the company and it must be requested at time of order!!??!!! Are you kidding me! So now the food comes. It's a very thin crust pizza which is ok. It's no where near an authentic quality pizza. It's ok, not the worse not the best just ok. The wings were absolutely horrid. Rubbery, baked, and no real sauce. Overall we were very disappointed with the customer service, the quality, atmosphere, and mainly the price! Very very over priced. So the reason for the one star is everything adding up and weighing out to that. We will not be back and wish this place all the luck.
